pullRequest.body:
This PR gives an equivalent condition to `regularTopology.EqualizerCondition` (previously called `regularCoverage.EqualizerCondition`), phrased in more categorical language. We use this new condition to show that `EqualizerCondition` respects natural isomorphisms.

---
- [x] depends on: #10421 
- [x] depends on: #11696

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body:
It seems one of the suggestions I made yesterday did not appear on github. I was suggesting generalizing the statements in order to obtain results directly for presheaves in any category, not just the category of types. See the commit https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/d423936e1dd36dd3b0545984a438c005c6e72440 on the draft branch [dagur_EqualizerConditionAPI_jriou](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/dagur_EqualizerConditionAPI_jriou)
I suggest defining an equalizer condition `SingleEqualizerCondition` for just one morphism and then define `EqualizerCondition` as this condition for all effective epi. Then, after adding the missing lemma `Presheaf.isSheaf_iff_isLimit_coverage` in `Sites.Coverage`, the characterization of sheaves `equalizerCondition_iff_isSheaf : EqualizerCondition F ↔ Presheaf.IsSheaf (regularTopology C) F` is reduced to the (sorried) verification that `SingleEqualizerCondition P π` holds iff `Nonempty (IsLimit (P.mapCone (Sieve.ofArrows (fun (_ : Unit) => X) (fun _ => π)).arrows.cocone.op))`.
@joelriou I finally managed to prove your lemma `equalizerConditionMap_iff_nonempty_isLimit`, it was harder than expected. I hope it's readable

Thanks for finding a nice proof! I had a more low tech approach, but using that a certain functor is initial is definitely a better approach. I will try to see soon how to make some improvements in the code.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#10421~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#11696~~

I prefer regularCoverage: regularTopology seems too much related to "true" topology.
`regularTopology` is consistent with `coherentTopology` and `extensiveTopology`. Do you not like those either or is it just this one because of the notion of regular topological space?

An obvious advantage of using `regularTopology` is that `regularTopology C` is a lot shorter than `(regularCoverage C).toGrothendieck`. 

Also, it's in the `CategoryTheory` namespace, which avoids confusion with general topology.

I agree `regularTopology` is better: writing
```lean
IsSheaf (regularTopology C) F
```
is nice.

```suggestion
  simp only [Category.assoc, Types.equalizerIso_inv_comp_ι, limit.lift_π, Fork.ofι_pt,
    Fork.ofι_π_app]
  rfl
```
Why the "aux" in the name?
Can you add a line of doc?

```suggestion
    [F.PreservesEffectiveEpis]
```

```suggestion
  rw [Category.assoc, Category.assoc, ← i.hom.naturality (pullback.fst (f := π) (g := π)).op,
    ← i.hom.naturality (pullback.snd (f := π) (g := π)).op, ← Category.assoc, equalizer.condition,
    Category.assoc, NatTrans.naturality]
```

```suggestion
    (hP : EqualizerCondition P) : EqualizerCondition P' := by
```
As commented above, I am not very much in favour of this renaming. Same comments below.
Resolving this to keep the discussion about the renaming on the first comment
See my comments in the first file about this renaming
Resolving this to keep the discussion about the renaming on the first comment

```suggestion
    {P P' : Cᵒᵖ ⥤ Type u} (i : P ≅ P') {X B : C} (π : X ⟶ B)
```
This is exactly the same (declaring `u` of course), but I think it is more readable. (Same below.)

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  · rw [equalizerCondition_iff_isIso_lift_aux_comp, ← isIso_iff_bijective]
```

In order to have an API which parallels what we have for `PreservesLimit`, could you change the definition of `EqualizerCondition` so that it becomes:
```lean
def EqualizerCondition (P : Cᵒᵖ ⥤ Type*) : Prop :=
  ∀ ⦃X B : C⦄ (π : X ⟶ B) [EffectiveEpi π] (c : PullbackCone π π) (_ : IsLimit c),
    Nonempty (IsLimit (P.mapCone (PushoutCocone.mk _ _ c.condition).op))
```
(Actually, you may also replace `Type*` by any category, which should allow handling (pre)sheaves in any category directly.)

(It would make sense to give a name to this definition `c => PushoutCocone.mk _ _ c.condition`, and maybe develop the relation of this construction with `EffectiveEpi`: show that if a pullback cocone like this is limit, then corresponding square is both cartesian and cocartesian.)

Then, I would think that when translated in the language of general pushout/pullback co/cones, the code would eventually look nicer.

More precisely, modulo a small refactor of `isLimitMapConePullbackConeEquiv` so that it allows any `PullbackCone` rather than those constructed by `PullbackCone.mk`, and a general compatibility of pullback squares with isos, the proof of `equalizerCondition_of_natIso` would become much easier:
```lean
section

variable {D : Type*} [Category D] (G : C ⥤ D) {X Y Z : C} {f : X ⟶ Z} {g : Y ⟶ Z}
  (c : PullbackCone f g)

def isLimitMapConePullbackConeEquiv :
    IsLimit (G.mapCone c) ≃
      IsLimit (PullbackCone.mk (G.map c.fst) (G.map c.snd)
      (by simpa using G.congr_map c.condition) : PullbackCone (G.map f) (G.map g)) := sorry
end

def PullbackCone.isLimitOfIsos {X₁ X₂ S : C} {f₁ : X₁ ⟶ S} {f₂ : X₂ ⟶ S}
    (c : PullbackCone f₁ f₂) (hc : IsLimit c) {X₁' X₂' S' : C}
    {f₁' : X₁' ⟶ S'} {f₂' : X₂' ⟶ S'} (c' : PullbackCone f₁' f₂')
    (e₀ : S ≅ S') (e₁ : X₁ ≅ X₁') (e₂ : X₂ ≅ X₂') (e : c.pt ≅ c'.pt)
    (comm₁ : e₁.hom ≫ f₁' = f₁ ≫ e₀.hom := by aesop_cat)
    (comm₂ : e₂.hom ≫ f₂' = f₂ ≫ e₀.hom := by aesop_cat)
    (comm₃ : e.hom ≫ c'.fst = c.fst ≫ e₁.hom := by aesop_cat)
    (comm₄ : e.hom ≫ c'.snd = c.snd ≫ e₂.hom := by aesop_cat) : IsLimit c' := sorry

theorem equalizerCondition_of_natIso {P P' : Cᵒᵖ ⥤ A} (i : P ≅ P')
    (hP : EqualizerCondition P) : EqualizerCondition P' := fun {X B} π _ c hc =>
  ⟨(isLimitMapConePullbackConeEquiv P' _).2
    (PullbackCone.isLimitOfIsos _ ((isLimitMapConePullbackConeEquiv P _).1 (hP π c hc).some) _
    (i.app _) (i.app _) (i.app _) (i.app _))⟩
```
Thanks for the suggestions! I didn't do the `mapCone` version, but a slightly different one which worked quite well. It also uses general pullback cones.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (w' : ι' ≫ f = ι' ≫ g) (h : ι = ι') : ```

```suggestion
  exact (IsLimit.equivOfNatIsoOfIso i c c' (Fork.ext e comm₃)) hc
```

In terms of API, I am not sure we need to introduce `EqualizerConditionExpl`: I would rather see this as a theorem `EqualizerCondition.bijective_mapToEqualizer_pullback`, and the converse would be a constructor `EqualizerCondition.mk`.

In terms of API, I am not sure we need to introduce `EqualizerConditionExpl`: I would rather see this as a theorem `EqualizerCondition.bijective_mapToEqualizer_pullback`, and the converse would be a constructor `EqualizerCondition.mk`.

I would suggest the following lemmas which could go into a new file `CategoryTheory.Limits.Final.ParallelPair`:
```lean
lemma _root_.CategoryTheory.Limits.parallelPair_initial_mk' {X Y : C} (f g : X ⟶ Y)
    (h₁ : ∀ Z, Nonempty (X ⟶ Z))
    (h₂ : ∀ ⦃Z : C⦄ (i j : X ⟶ Z),
      Zigzag (J := CostructuredArrow (parallelPair f g) Z)
        (CostructuredArrow.mk (Y := zero) i)
        (CostructuredArrow.mk (Y := zero) j)) : (parallelPair f g).Initial where
  out Z := by
    have : Nonempty (CostructuredArrow (parallelPair f g) Z) :=
      ⟨CostructuredArrow.mk (Y := zero) (h₁ Z).some⟩
    have : ∀ (x : CostructuredArrow (parallelPair f g) Z), Zigzag x
      (CostructuredArrow.mk (Y := zero) (h₁ Z).some) := by
        rintro ⟨(_|_), ⟨⟩, φ⟩
        · apply h₂
        · refine Relation.ReflTransGen.trans ?_ (h₂ (f ≫ φ) _)
          exact Relation.ReflTransGen.single (Or.inr ⟨CostructuredArrow.homMk left⟩)
    exact zigzag_isConnected (fun x y => (this x).trans (zigzag_symmetric (this y)))

lemma _root_.CategoryTheory.Limits.parallelPair_initial_mk {X Y : C} (f g : X ⟶ Y)
    (h₁ : ∀ Z, Nonempty (X ⟶ Z))
    (h₂ : ∀ ⦃Z : C⦄ (i j : X ⟶ Z), ∃ (a : Y ⟶ Z), i = f ≫ a ∧ j = g ≫ a) :
    (parallelPair f g).Initial :=
  parallelPair_initial_mk' f g h₁ (fun Z i j => by
    obtain ⟨a, rfl, rfl⟩ := h₂ i j
    have z₁ : Zigzag (J := CostructuredArrow (parallelPair f g) Z)
      (CostructuredArrow.mk (Y := zero) (f ≫ a))
      (CostructuredArrow.mk (Y := one) a) := Relation.ReflTransGen.single
        (Or.inl ⟨CostructuredArrow.homMk left⟩)
    have z₃ : Zigzag (J := CostructuredArrow (parallelPair f g) Z)
      (CostructuredArrow.mk (Y := one) a)
      (CostructuredArrow.mk (Y := zero) (g ≫ a)) := Relation.ReflTransGen.single
        (Or.inr ⟨CostructuredArrow.homMk right⟩)
    exact z₁.trans z₃)
```
I believe that the general API for zigzags could be improved. A first step would be to remove the `reducible` tag to `Zigzag` and `Zag`, and introduce suitable lemmas (like `Zag.of_hom`, `zag.of_inv`, `Zag.symm`, `Zigzag.trans`, etc.) because I have felt that there is too much `Relation.ReflTransGen` API leakage.

For convenience, the following API for the category attached to a presieve could be introduced:
```lean
-- change the definition of `Presieve.diagram` to make this the source category
abbrev _root_.CategoryTheory.Presieve.category {X : C} (P : Presieve X) :=
  FullSubcategory fun f : Over X => P f.hom

abbrev _root_.CategoryTheory.Presieve.categoryMk {X : C} (P : Presieve X)
  {Y : C} (f : Y ⟶ X) (hf : P f) : P.category := ⟨Over.mk f, hf⟩
```

Then, the phrasing of this lemma can be slightly improved:
```lean
theorem parallelPair_pullback_initial {X B : C} (π : X ⟶ B)
    (c : PullbackCone π π) (hc : IsLimit c) :
    (parallelPair (C := (Sieve.ofArrows (fun (_ : Unit) => X) (fun _ => π)).arrows.categoryᵒᵖ)
    (Y := op ((Presieve.categoryMk _ (c.fst ≫ π) ⟨_, c.fst, π, ofArrows.mk (), rfl⟩)))
    (X := op ((Presieve.categoryMk _ π (Sieve.ofArrows_mk _ _ Unit.unit))))
    (Quiver.Hom.op (Over.homMk c.fst)) (Quiver.Hom.op (Over.homMk c.snd c.condition.symm))).Initial := by
  apply Limits.parallelPair_initial_mk
  all_goals sorry
```
(I am thinking that we could also introduce an abbreviation `Sieve.ofSingleArrow π`.)
Ok, I've filled in this sorry. I'll clean everything up tomorrow,

```suggestion
/-- The full subcategory of the over category `C/X` consisting of arrows which belong to a presieve of `X`. -/
```

```suggestion
lemma equalizerCondition_w' (P : Cᵒᵖ ⥤ Type*) {X B : C} (π : X ⟶ B)
```
I believe that this proof can be cleaned up a bit due to the new API.
It uses the `Presieve.category` API now. Did you have anything else in mind?

```suggestion
    [HasPullback π π] : SingleEqualizerCondition P π ↔
```

```suggestion
        (mk (Y := zero) i) (mk (Y := zero) j)) :
    (parallelPair f g).Initial where
```

```suggestion
    ∀ (X B : C) (π : X ⟶ B) [EffectiveEpi π] [HasPullback π π],
      IsIso (equalizer.lift (P.map π.op) (equalizerCondition_w' P π)) := by
```
The docstring at the beginning of the file should be changed because it refers to a lemma `isSheaf_iff_equalizerCondition`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Sites): add some API for regular sheaves and the equalizer condition

source.title: feat(Condensed): explicit sheaf condition for light condensed objects

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory.Limits.IsConnected): colimit of singletons is singleton iff index category is connected
